snippet: ROBBINS--Jack, 73, of New York City, died January 5, 2016. Born April 20, 1942, in Comanche County, KS, he grew up in Wichita. At 21, he moved to Washington, D.C., then to New York City. He worked at the New York Post as a copyboy, then reporter and feature writer. He spent five years as a full-time parent and freelance copy- editor, and finished his career on the copy desk at Business Week. In retirement he indulged in his passions: movies, the gym, and the New York Mets. He is survived by his wife, Sonia; their daughter, Christie; his brother Jim; nieces and nephews; and numerous friends around the world. He will be remembered for his wit and generosity. A memorial will be held on March 5, 2pm, at Judson Memorial Church Assembly Hall, 239 Thompson St., New York, NY. In lieu of donations, take a family member or a friend to the movies. 1/3

In retirement he indulged in his passions: movies, the gym, and the New York Mets. He is survived by his wife, Sonia; their daughter, Christie; his brother Jim; nieces and nephews; and numerous friends around the world. He will be remembered for his wit and generosity.
